title: Of the Lord's Supper
text: The Supper of the Lord is not a sacrifice for the quick and the dead, but a remembrance of the sacrifice of Christ ... and to be received in faith, with thanksgiving.
commentary: Article 28, “Of the Lord's Supper”, states: The Supper of the Lord is not a sacrifice for the quick and the dead, but a remembrance of the sacrifice of Christ . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
